intro: Sida tehuelches, commonly known as the Tehuelche mallow, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Argentina and Chile. It is a shrub that can grow up to 1.5 meters tall, with hairy, lance-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Its flowers are typically clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds. The plant is adapted to withstand drought and has a deep root system for moisture retention.
